comment.body: That's the peril of working in the open, showing things off before they are fully done. I much prefer that way of working, but it comes with its downsides as well. When there was only ZeroID the statement about IDs being a centralizing point was true, but there are many different ID providers now. The same happened with ZeroBoard, it was partly centralized because ZeroNet didn't have all the necessary features when it was made to be fully decentralized, but now it's so easy to make a fully decentralized chat that making one is even the one official ZeroNet tutorial. But it still gave a lot of people the wrong impression, much later.

The "latest" tab makes the site sooo much better already. If anyone is having trouble with the site now, it only worked well for me again after I updated ZeroNet to the latest dev version, which made some changes to big file support among other things.
The Facebook one works on multiple levels. Lots of people, but the giant ads towering over the people take the center stage.
